intro: Dampiera trigona var. latealata, commonly known as the Narrow-leaf Dampiera, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered white flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils in coastal or inland areas. It is often found in heathlands and open woodlands, thriving in well-drained conditions. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
